documents.text:
--- Visit 1 | Date: 2025-06-24 ---

Visit 1 — MISSED. Patient called to reschedule but did not attend. spoke with patient, rescheduling.

--- Visit 2 | Date: 2025-07-15 ---

SA-P003 — Cycle 2, Day 1 visit.

Vitals: BP 121/93 mmHg, HR 68 bpm, Weight 91.4 kg.

Routine labs obtained:
  - PSA: 5.44 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 33.87 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 13.54 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 11.85 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 9.37 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.17 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Imaging assessment: Target lesion decreased from baseline — measured reduction of approximately 42.3%. Partial response per RECIST 1.1 criteria.

PSA now 6.19 ng/mL — decrease 42.3% from initial value.

Assessment: Tolerating therapy. Plan to continue protocol. Next visit in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 3 | Date: 2025-08-05 ---

Follow-up visit #3 for patient SA-P003.

Vitals: BP 136/85 mmHg, HR 76 bpm, Weight 85.9 kg.

Lab panel results from today's draw:
  - PSA: 4.77 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 32.22 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 13.3 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 11.3 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 8.11 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.24 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Plan: Continue current dose. Return for cycle 4 in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 4 | Date: 2025-08-26 ---

Visit 4 clinical encounter for SA-P003.

On exam, BP is 118/70, pulse 68, wt 82.8 kg. Patient appears comfortable, no distress noted.

Blood work results:
  - PSA: 4.93 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 31.43 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 15.78 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 11.08 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 8.51 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.2 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Imaging: Target lesion measurements stable — neither sufficient shrinkage for PR nor increase for PD. Classified as stable disease (SD) per RECIST.

Serum PSA: 11.33 ng/mL, representing a increase of 5.5% compared to baseline.

Continue study protocol. Monitor labs. Return visit 5 scheduled in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 5 | Date: 2025-09-16 ---

Routine protocol visit 5. Patient ID: SA-P003.

Vital signs obtained: blood pressure 132/74, heart rate 71, weight 76.8 kg.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Blood work results:
  - PSA: 3.96 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 33.8 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 16.46 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 11.26 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 8.11 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.29 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Continue study protocol. Monitor labs. Return visit 6 scheduled in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 6 | Date: 2025-10-07 ---

Routine protocol visit 6. Patient ID: SA-P003.

Vital signs obtained: blood pressure 152/81, heart rate 79, weight 69.9 kg.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Routine labs obtained:
  - PSA: 4.75 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 35.7 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 15.18 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 10.95 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 7.66 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.32 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3] (HIGH)

Imaging reveals meaningful tumor shrinkage consistent with partial response (PR). Target lesion regression of ~22.0%.

Serum PSA: 8.38 ng/mL, representing a decrease of 22.0% compared to baseline.

Assessment: Tolerating therapy. Plan to continue protocol. Next visit in 3 weeks.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Routine labs obtained:

Vital signs obtained: blood pressure 117/70, heart rate 71, weight 85.5 kg.

Routine labs obtained:

  - Creatinine: 1.33 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3] (HIGH)

Imaging: Target lesion measurements stable — neither sufficient shrinkage for PR nor increase for PD. Classified as stable disease (SD) per RECIST.

PSA now 10.01 ng/mL — decrease 6.8% from initial value.

Continue study protocol. Monitor labs. Return visit 9 scheduled in 3 weeks.
